column4: do you guys know where i can get lvc from?? i look for it in synaptic but for whatever reason it's not there

VLC
stands for vido lan client, i think
work well?
yep. one of the best
personally i don't like the interface, but it plays pretty much anything
i use xine when i can. then vlc or mplayer when it doesn't play something
yes
it would be under Multimedia right
i find xine easy to use, and it plays pretty much everything once you've installed the codecs from the repo
repo?
yeah. i don't use the categories though. it's easier to just search for what you're looking for, or apt-get it
repo = short for repository
do you know if it would be gxine?
that's the gnome xine interface
i prefer the regular xine
xine-ui then?
yeah
that would be xine User Interface
k, thx =) i tried Totem for some Dvds... and I dunno if it was my computer or totem, but they just wouldn't play so I'm gonna try xine first before going any further
i find xine is great with DVDs & CDs. it has buttons for that. just click & it plays
does the menus too, IIRC
do you know how to like rip straight to your drive?
so you can watch anytime ...
yeh, there's a bunch of apps for that. try searching
kk =)
handy sites: google.com/linux & www.sf.net
it's a library that lets your apps decode encrytped dvds
o... i'm guessing that xine should do that as well?
yeah
actually, i dunno if it uses that, cause i have it too
might do it on it's own though
i just got xine installed... so going to try it but how do you do repository stuff?
uh, what 'repository stuff'?
well.... you said you can download codecs from the repository?
yeh, do a search in description & name for codec
:p
lol thx =) i think I'm done bothering you for a bit ;-)
and see the link nalioths_dog posted for adding repositories
atleast for now ;-)
real quick question, how do i turn it so that Totem doens't start my DVDs up automatically?
hrm. that's probably a gnome setting. poke around in the menus
can't help much as i'm not on either gnome or ubuntu ATM
o, =) kk
might poke around in totem's settings actually...
yea... still looking and I'm not finding anything just yet...
if a folder or file is 'locked' then you don't have permissions because you either aren't the owner, or aren't root
just a note in case you don't know... never log in as root, except in a terminal, and only if necessary. use sudo instead
yea! see... how do you use sudo to open up the folder and create a codec folder inside?
if you want to create a sub folder, then in a terminal, put 'sudo mkdir foldername'
use the full path if you can't cd into that dir first
another handy tip if you don't know: use tab completion
sudo = Super User DO. ie, do as super user (root)
you can use it to run just about any command as root
i just haven't learned all the mkdir, and such commands yet...
yeh.. they're handy to know. use 'man' frequently
will do =) how do you extract files into the folder once you are ready though? with like the sudo command?
you can either change the permissions on the folder, or do it as root. as i said, you can run most commands as root with sudo: 'sudo command arguments'
see 'man sudo'
i just gotta find out what the sudo command is to extra files though
er, no. you need the command to extract files or whatever it is you're trying to do. then just put sudo in front of it to do it as root
oooo lol
k then.. i need to know the extract command for terminal =D
could be tar, unzip, unrar, etc
prolly tar. 'man tar'
yea, it just says .tar.bz2
is this your idea of ripping...?
you ought to be able to extract it in nautilus or something
you don't have to do everything in the terminal
oh yeah... no permissions
yea... but when i try to extract it in whatever progam Ubuntu uses... it says I don't have permission and I don't know how to get past it
did you check what's _in_ the file first?
are you sure it has the codecs, and only the codecs in them? might also have source, etc. IOW, things you don't need in /usr/lib
yea... and it has a readme that says to put all the files into /usr/local/lib/codecs
k
that's a confusing error, lol
ahem. shouldn't paste in here
there's rafb.net/paste and stuff liek that for pasting
did you use tab completion?
type the first few chars, and hit tab, and it completes it for you
yea... but now it says - r is an invalid option... is that right?? sudo mkir -r?
man mkdir :p
as you can see in 'man mkdir' there's no -r option
that's why tab completion helps. use it. frequently
did the second time around and that's the only reason i figured it out ;-)
yeh. copy & paste that
* is a wildcard
usually that means success. otherwise it gives an error/info message
kk
64 if you can
